meanings.definition: A type of protein that helps regulate immune responses and inflammation.
meanings.sent1: The interleukin played a crucial role in controlling the body's defense system.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are studying how interleukins can impact our body's ability to fight infections.
meanings.sent3: The interleukin decided to throw a party for the immune system cells.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like an interleukin, soothing the inflammation of disagreements.
meanings.sent5: The interleukin was like a traffic cop, directing the immune responses efficiently.

meanings.definition: Any of a group of cytokines that are produced by white blood cells.
meanings.sent1: White blood cells release interleukins to communicate with other immune cells.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are investigating the role of interleukins in the body's defense mechanisms.
meanings.sent3: The white blood cell factory was busy producing interleukins for the immune system.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like interleukins, spreading messages of support throughout the body.
meanings.sent5: The interleukins were like messengers, delivering important instructions to the immune system.
